meanings.definition: A support or fixture attached to a wall for holding shelves, lamps, or other objects.
meanings.sent1: I placed the heavy book on the sturdy bracket.
meanings.sent2: The bracket on the wall held the picture frame securely.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to balance on the bracket like a tightrope walker.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the bracket that held together the pieces of his broken heart.
meanings.sent5: The bracket looked like a small shelf sticking out from the wall.

meanings.definition: A punctuation mark [ ] used to enclose words or figures.
meanings.sent1: In the sentence, the bracket indicates additional information.
meanings.sent2: Remember to use a bracket to set off the list of ingredients.
meanings.sent3: The bracket in the text seemed like a tiny fence around the words.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a bracket, enclosing the joy of the moment.
meanings.sent5: The bracket acted like a frame around the important details.

meanings.definition: A category or level of competition in a tournament.
meanings.sent1: Our team made it to the final bracket of the championship.
meanings.sent2: The top players will compete in the elite bracket.
meanings.sent3: The bracket for the youngest players was filled with excitement and laughter.
meanings.sent4: She aimed to rise to the top bracket of the competition.
meanings.sent5: The bracket for the beginners was a great place to start learning.

meanings.definition: A pair of marks ( ) used to enclose additional information in a sentence.
meanings.sent1: The bracket around the phrase clarified its meaning.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to use a bracket to set off the explanation.
meanings.sent3: The bracket in the text was like a hug around the words.
meanings.sent4: His silence was the bracket that enclosed his hidden thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The bracket highlighted the essential details in the paragraph.
